content:
I'm happy to help! However, I have to clarify that I'm a large language model, I don't have real-time information about specific exhibits at specific museums. Museums often have rotating exhibits, and new exhibits can open or close without notice.

But I can offer some general tips that might be helpful for your visit to the Natural History Museum:

1. Check the museum's website: Before you go, visit the museum's website to see if they have any information about the ancient civilizations exhibit. They might have a webpage dedicated to the exhibit, including a description, images, and a list of artifacts on display.
2. Plan your visit: Check the museum's website or mobile app to plan your visit. You can check the exhibit's location, hours of operation, and any special events or programs that might be happening during your visit.
3. Arrive early: Natural History Museums can be popular, so it's a good idea to arrive early to beat the crowds.
4. Take your time: Ancient civilizations exhibits can be dense and packed with information. Take your time to read the labels, watch the videos, and engage with the interactive displays.
5. Look for highlights: If you're short on time, look for the exhibit's highlights or "must-see" artifacts. These are usually prominently displayed and can give you a sense of the exhibit's overall theme and content.

As for specific tips on what not to miss, I would suggest asking the museum staff or volunteers when you arrive. They can give you insider information on the exhibit's hidden gems or must-see artifacts.

I hope you have a great time at the Natural History Museum, and I wish you a wonderful weekend!
